page.title: 17HEBBURN QUAY
page.content: This area was settled because of the {River Tyne.Andrew Leslie}from Glasgow chose this area to open his {shipbuilding}yard over 100 years ago.There followed houses for the workers, a school and a church.These buildings are still there.Ten years ago the Quay had become very run down.The{council}had bought the {terraced houses}and people did not want to live there, preferring newer houses in different parts of Hebburn.The council decided to sell them rather than pull them down and gave large grants to modernise the properties.Work is still going on to improve the area by{renovation}and landscaping.Most residents are happy to stay there.Due to unemployment the area is poor but it is once again a {community. }
